docs.lead_paragraph: The House Budget Committee tonight adopted a Republican tax and spending plan for next year that would give President Bush the money he wants to combat terrorism but hold down the deficit by cutting or tightly limiting financing for many other programs. The $2.1 trillion election-year budget plan would increase military spending by $46.3 billion, or 13.3 percent, and nearly double, to $37.7 billion, money for domestic security needs like bioterrorism preparedness, border patrols, and training and equipment for fire and police departments.

headline.main: G.O.P. Blueprint for Budget Is Approved by House Panel

docs.abstract: House Budget Committee adopts Republican tax and spending plan for next year that would give Pres Bush money he wants to combat terrorism but hold down deficit by cutting or tightly limiting financing for many government programs; budget would raise military spending by 13.3 percent, or $46.3 billion, and nearly double, to $37.7 billion, money for domestic security needs; projects deficit of $45.6 billion after deficit for current year that it projects at $65.7 billion; Democrats say plan is proof that tax cut Bush pushed through Congress in 2001 was fiscally reckless (M)
docs.snippet: The House Budget Committee tonight adopted a Republican tax and spending plan for next year that would give President Bush the money he wants to combat terrorism but hold down the deficit by cutting or tightly limiting financing for many other...

docs.lead_paragraph: AT 62, in good health and the roles still coming, Cary Grant stepped into the wings of retirement. Loretta Young made the move at 50. Jessica Tandy seemed not to know the meaning of the word. In Hollywood, there are no definite rules about when to retire, how to retire or what to do in retirement.

headline.main: In Hollywood, No One Gets A Casting Call for This Role

docs.abstract: Movie roles for actors and actresses disappear as they get older, except in rare cases; Bonnie Bartlett, other older actors comment; photo (special section, Retirement) (M)
